member.name: T:Bonsai.Vision.BackgroundSubtraction
member.summary: Represents an operator that performs image segmentation of every frame in the sequence using an online estimation of the background.

member.name: P:Bonsai.Vision.BackgroundSubtraction.BackgroundFrames
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of frames to use for initial background estimation.

member.name: P:Bonsai.Vision.BackgroundSubtraction.AdaptationRate
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining how fast the online estimation of the background is adapted.

member.name: P:Bonsai.Vision.BackgroundSubtraction.ThresholdValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the threshold value used to test whether individual pixels are foreground or background.

member.name: P:Bonsai.Vision.BackgroundSubtraction.ThresholdType
member.summary: Gets or sets a value specifying the type of threshold to apply to individual pixels.

member.name: P:Bonsai.Vision.BackgroundSubtraction.SubtractionMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets a value specifying the subtraction method used to isolate foreground pixels.

member.name: M:Bonsai.Vision.BackgroundSubtraction.Process(System.IObservable{OpenCV.Net.IplImage})
member.summary: Performs image segmentation of every frame in an observable sequence using an online estimation of the background.
member.param: The sequence of frames on which to perform image segmentation.
member.returns: The sequence of images which have been segmented into foreground and background pixels.

member.name: T:Bonsai.Vision.SubtractionMethod
member.summary: Specifies the subtraction method used to isolate foreground pixels.

member.name: F:Bonsai.Vision.SubtractionMethod.Absolute
member.summary: Take the absolute difference between the online estimation of the background and the current frame so that any pixels which are different from the the background can be considered foreground.

member.name: F:Bonsai.Vision.SubtractionMethod.Bright
member.summary: Subtract the online estimation of the background from the current image so that only pixels which are brighter than the background can be classified as foreground.

member.name: F:Bonsai.Vision.SubtractionMethod.Dark
member.summary: Subtract the current image from the online estimation of the background so that only pixels which are darker than the background can be classified as foreground.

member.name: T:Bonsai.Vision.BinaryRegionAnalysis
member.summary: Represents an operator that computes image moments from polygonal contours or individual frames in the sequence to extract binary region properties.
member.remarks: If the area of any of the extracted connected components is zero, the centroid and orientation angle for that connected component will be set to .

member.name: M:Bonsai.Vision.BinaryRegionAnalysis.Process(System.IObservable{OpenCV.Net.IplImage})
member.summary: Computes image moments from individual frames in an observable sequence to extract binary region properties.
member.param: A sequence of rasterized shapes where every non-zero pixel is treated as having a weight of one.
member.returns: A sequence of objects containing the binary region measurements for all the pixels in the image considered as a single object.

member.name: M:Bonsai.Vision.BinaryRegionAnalysis.Process(System.IObservable{OpenCV.Net.Seq})
member.summary: Computes image moments from individual polygons in an observable sequence to extract binary region properties.
member.param: A sequence of polygons for which to compute binary region properties.
member.returns: A sequence of objects containing the binary region measurements for all the polygons in the sequence.

member.name: M:Bonsai.Vision.BinaryRegionAnalysis.Process(System.IObservable{Bonsai.Vision.Contours})
member.summary: Computes image moments from polygonal contours in an observable sequence to extract binary region properties.
member.param: A sequence of hierarchical polygonal contours for which to compute binary region properties.
member.returns: A sequence of objects containing the binary region measurements for all the polygons in the hierarchy of polygonal contours.

member.name: M:Bonsai.Vision.BinaryRegionAnalysis.Process(System.IObservable{System.Tuple{Bonsai.Vision.Contours,OpenCV.Net.IplImage}})
member.summary: Computes image moments from polygonal contours in an observable sequence to extract binary region properties, where each binary region will be associated with a corresponding patch of pixels.
member.param: A sequence of hierarchical polygonal contours for which to compute binary region properties, paired with the image from which they were extracted.
member.returns: A sequence of objects containing the binary region measurements for all the polygons in the hierarchy of polygonal contours. Each binary region will be associated with the subregion of the paired image corresponding to the bounding box of the binary region shape.

member.name: T:Bonsai.Vision.BinaryRegionExtremes
member.summary: Represents an operator that computes the extremities, or endpoints, of each connected component in the sequence.

member.name: P:Bonsai.Vision.BinaryRegionExtremes.Method
member.summary: Gets or sets a value specifying the method used to compute the extremities of each connected component.

member.name: M:Bonsai.Vision.BinaryRegionExtremes.Process(System.IObservable{Bonsai.Vision.ConnectedComponent})
member.summary: Computes the extremities, or endpoints, of each connected component in an observable sequence.
member.param: The sequence of connected components for which to compute the extremities.
member.returns: A pair of vertices specifying the two extremities, or endpoints, of each connected component in the sequence. If the connected component has no vertices, the endpoint coordinates will be set to .

member.name: T:Bonsai.Vision.FindExtremesMethod
member.summary: Specifies the method used to compute extremities of connected components.

member.name: F:Bonsai.Vision.FindExtremesMethod.Horizontal
member.summary: The first extremity will be the vertex furthest to the right, and the second extremity the vertex furthest to the left, in image coordinates.

member.name: F:Bonsai.Vision.FindExtremesMethod.Vertical
member.summary: The first extremity will be the vertex nearest to the bottom of the image, and the second extremity the vertex nearest to the top of the image.

member.name: F:Bonsai.Vision.FindExtremesMethod.MajorAxis
member.summary: The first extremity will be the vertex furthest along the major axis of the ellipse fit to the connected component, moving clockwise, and the second extremity will be the vertex furthest along the major axis of the ellipse, moving anti-clockwise.

member.name: F:Bonsai.Vision.FindExtremesMethod.MajorAxisVertex
member.summary: The first extremity will be the first clockwise vertex of the ellipse fit to the connected component and the second extremity the first anti-clockwise vertex of the ellipse.

member.name: F:Bonsai.Vision.FindExtremesMethod.Radial
member.summary: The first extremity will be the vertex furthest away from the centroid of the connected component, and the second extremity will be the vertex furthest away from the first extremity.
